stories.title: Extending our Envoy mesh with staging overrides

stories.text:
My sister is trying to get into a PhD program. She has emailed about a dozen professors, and she's having a lot of trouble getting any of them to even respond back to her emails, let alone getting any information. Since most schools seem to require reaching out to a professor first, this has become a substantial blocker.

I was curious if anyone here who worked in academia knew of a better way to contact professors than just a random email for this kind of thing. Would it make sense to try and call them, or send a physical letter?

NOTE: Her location is the United States.
stories.title: Ask HN: Best way for someone to reach professors to get into a PhD Program?
Eric Schmidt: “Phone Call from Meg Whitman”

stories.text:
Hi HN. I am completely green when it comes to raising funds. I have bootstrapped a business that helps ecommerce companies connect with 3rd party logistics centers.

I currently have $5k MMR and want to grow fairly stable and hire on 3 developers, 1 qa, 1 designer, and 1 sales next year sometime when funding is there.

I am not sure how to go about seeking investment. Angellist looks like a good option but I need to incorporate in DE through them?

I guess I am just looking for other business owners to talk to figure out a game plan?
stories.title: Ask HN: Use Angellist for incorporating? Trying to raise funds
